isis.stitle: TSI 07-12-07 - Prevention of Objects and Debris from Falling into Intake Ports during Removal and Installation of Intake Manifold

subjectgroup.subject: Prevention of Objects and Debris from Falling into Intake Ports during Removal and Installation of Intake Manifold

geninfo.para: The following procedure is necessary to eliminate hardware, tools, objects, dirt, and debris from falling into intake ports in the cylinder heads, when the intake manifold is removed and installed.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, shift transmission to park or neutral, set parking brake, and block wheels before doing diagnostic or service procedures.
To prevent personal injury or death, make sure the engine has cooled before removing components.
To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields when doing the following procedure.

note.para: See Engine Service Manual for procedures to remove engine components before removing the intake manifold.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, the following steps must be done in sequence and exactly as stated.

step1.para: Remove loose hardware, tools, and objects from the area below the intake manifold and from recessed area between the right and left rocker arm carrier and intake manifold.

note.para: See Engine Service Manual to remove intake manifold.

step1.para: Blow out or vacuum dirt and debris from the area below the intake manifold and recessed area between the right and left rocker arm carrier and intake manifold.
Carefully remove dirt and debris from around mating surfaces of intake ports, making sure dirt or debris does not fall into intake ports.
Use a borescope to inspect the inside of intake ports.
Remove objects and debris from intake ports.

note.para: Use a magnet to remove metal objects or fragments.

step1.para: Put magnetic cover ZTSE4559 over intake ports in each cylinder head.

note.para: After necessary maintenance, follow procedures in the Engine Service Manual to install the intake manifold.

step1.para: Remove magnetic cover over intake ports.
Before installing the intake manifold, use a borescope to make sure intake ports are free of objects and debris.

note.para: Use a magnet to remove metal objects or fragments.
